metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9092 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
libjpeg-turbo before 1.3.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted JPEG file, related to the Exif marker.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
libturbojpeg - 1.5.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> libjpeg-turbo in Ubuntu is not based on the Debian package.

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.1-0ubuntu1').
